bibl.title: A New Papyrus (P. Egypt. Mus. Inv. S.R. 3055) and the Equestrian Officers from Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: Discusses the equestrian military career of the archidikastes Tib. Iulius Vestinianus Asklepiades, qui et Leonidas, mentioned in P. Cair. Inv. SR 3055 [ed.: Alia HANAFI, Three Applications from Oxyrhynchus, Proceedings of the XIXth International Congress of Papyrology. I (Cairo, 1992) pp. 561-577], P. Mil Vogl. I, 25, col. V, 10-13 and VI, 264. Survey of the known commanders of the cohortes Bracarum/Bracaraugustanorum. - Prosopographia of the equestrian officers from Egypt. - Observations on the Hellenized and Romanized elite of Roman Egypt.
